document.docTitle: Triplectides mariannae Malm & Johanson, 2008, new species
document.masterDocTitle: Description of eleven new Triplectides species (Trichoptera: Leptoceridae) from New Caledonia

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of eleven new Triplectides species (Trichoptera: Leptoceridae) from New Caledonia

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. This species is separated from most New Caledonian
Triplectides
species by the presence of 4 hind tibial spurs. It is easily distinguished from
smithi
,
aequalichelatus
, new species , and
dawnae
, new species , by having shorter mesal lobe of the inferior appendages and in the shape of tergum X. It strongly resembles
nathaliae
and
wardi
, the former recognized by the absence of fork 1 in the hind wings; the latter has a more rounded apical margin of tergum X.

Etymology. Named after PhD student Marianne Espeland, for her valued contribution during the collection of the
Triplectides
material in 2006 .

Holotype male:
New Caledonia : Province Sud:
stream draining to Marais de la Rivière Blanche, 1.35 km S Pont Pérignon,

,
